title: Ticket #6330: Improve error message for missing /var/run/condor under systemd
description:
On a systemd host that has /var/run/condor and/or /var/lock/condor on tmpfs, we rely on systemd-tmpfiles-setup configuration to automatically create the relevant folders owned by the condor user/group. The problem occurs when a site has the condor user in LDAP (which is not recommended) and the systemd-tmpfiles-setup service cannot create the folders with the proper ownership. This shows up in the MasterLog as the following: 

06/30/17 16:43:29 error opening watchdog pipe /var/run/condor/procd_pipe.watchdog: No such file or directory (2)

We should be able to detect that the condor user exists and that the systemd-tmpfiles-setup service failed: 

# systemctl status systemd-tmpfiles-setup
● systemd-tmpfiles-setup.service - Create Volatile Files and Directories
   Loaded: loaded (/usr/lib/systemd/system/systemd-tmpfiles-setup.service; static; vendor preset: disabled)
   Active: failed (Result: exit-code) since Fri 2017-06-30 14:38:14 CDT; 4 days ago
     Docs: man:tmpfiles.d(5)
           man:systemd-tmpfiles(8)
  Process: 429 ExecStart=/usr/bin/systemd-tmpfiles --create --remove --boot --exclude-prefix=/dev (code=exited, status=1/FAILURE)
 Main PID: 429 (code=exited, status=1/FAILURE)

Jun 30 14:38:14 fnalimage systemd[1]: Starting Create Volatile Files and Directories...
Jun 30 14:38:14 fnalimage systemd-tmpfiles[429]: [/usr/lib/tmpfiles.d/condor-ce.conf:1] Unknown user 'condor'.
Jun 30 14:38:14 fnalimage systemd-tmpfiles[429]: [/usr/lib/tmpfiles.d/condor-ce.conf:2] Unknown user 'condor'.
Jun 30 14:38:14 fnalimage systemd-tmpfiles[429]: [/usr/lib/tmpfiles.d/condor-ce.conf:3] Unknown user 'condor'.
Jun 30 14:38:14 fnalimage systemd-tmpfiles[429]: [/usr/lib/tmpfiles.d/condor.conf:2] Unknown user 'condor'.
Jun 30 14:38:14 fnalimage systemd-tmpfiles[429]: [/usr/lib/tmpfiles.d/condor.conf:4] Unknown user 'condor'.
Jun 30 14:38:14 fnalimage systemd[1]: systemd-tmpfiles-setup.service: main process exited, code=exited, status=1/FAILURE
Jun 30 14:38:14 fnalimage systemd[1]: Failed to start Create Volatile Files and Directories.
Jun 30 14:38:14 fnalimage systemd[1]: Unit systemd-tmpfiles-setup.service entered failed state.
Jun 30 14:38:14 fnalimage systemd[1]: systemd-tmpfiles-setup.service failed.

We should provide a more informative message saying that the proper dir doesn't exist and this can be caused by the condor user being in LDAP.
remarks:
2019-Jun-25 09:35:14 by tim:
This has been made moot by #7101. The master creates the necessary directories at startup if they are not there. This is in the 8.8.4 release.
